definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: She stays and waits for Ross to return so she can tell him.
sentences.chinese: 她留下來等待羅斯返家，並打算親口轉告他。

sentences.english: Mr Green leaves Beijing for home tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 格林先生定於明天離京返家。

sentences.english: They were driving home from Almaty.
sentences.chinese: 當時他們正從阿拉木圖返家。

sentences.english: Almost all the refugee camps have closed, and their residents returned home.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎所有的難民營都關閉，難民們重返家園。

sentences.english: He arrived home safely on Saturday, according to Xinhua.
sentences.chinese: 據新華社報到，他在星期六的時候安全返家。

sentences.english: If you cannot return on schedule, be sure to inform the host family by phone.
sentences.chinese: 若未能於預定時間返家時，須以電話向接待家庭報備。

sentences.english: With all of her supplies ready, Mary went back home to ride out the typhoon.
sentences.chinese: 買齊所有物品後，瑪莉便返家安渡颱風天。

sentences.english: Walking back from work everyday is a pleasure as well as an exercise.
sentences.chinese: 每日下班返家，安步當車，也算一種鍛鍊，一種樂趣。

sentences.english: The Secretary General promised them they would be able to return home.
sentences.chinese: 潘基文許諾說，他們將能重返家園。

definition: to go out/to leave for another place
to knock off work for the day
to leave hospital/to be discharged from hospital
